result.execSummary:
The defendant Lutrell J Rainey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
*Pay $100.00 fine plus all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges by 11/03/16. Failure to pay will result in an immediate entry of a civil judgment.
*Court ordered DNA sample after today's proceedings.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lutrell J Rainey

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1:

Court sentences defendant to serve 3 days in the House of Correction with credit for 3 (three) days, a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court ordered defendant pay $100.00 FINE plus all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges by November 3, 2016. Failure to pay will result in an immediate entry of a civil judgment.
.
Court ordered DNA sample after today's proceedings.

Filed;
-Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Lutrell J Rainey in court with attorney Christina E. Balistreri on behalf of attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

AS TO COUNT 1:

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

Defendant Lutrell J Rainey in court, attorney Attorney Balistreri on behalf of attorney Mark A. Pecora appeared.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Pre-trial conference held off the record. Case set in error at 1:30 p.m. Defense counsel requests projected guilty plea.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 37.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea hearing scheduled for November 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Lutrell J Rainey in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date received and filed with court.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Lutrell J Rainey in court.  Alex Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for a pre-trial conference. Defendant needs time to obtain counsel.   Court ordered case adjourned for status of counsel conference in Branch 37.  Status conference scheduled for July 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
05-26-15
Cash bail that was previously posted to remain. Oral No Weapons Order  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 06-04-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.   Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 37.vb

Defendant Lutrell J Rainey in court.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
